lines.text:
[Mary is upset about leaving New York for England]
Close your eyes. Can you see us?

[she has her eyes closed]
No.
Well, you're not looking hard enough. Look harder. Way in the back. Can you see us now?
Yeah.
Ok what are we doing?
Michael's drawing, Jack's looking in the mirror, and you're watching basketball on TV yelling at Jack for not cleaning up the kitchen!
Well, that sounds about right to me!

[Also said in _Three Men and A Baby (1987)_]
I'll give you $1,000 if you do it.

[gets shocked by television]
Ohhh shit!
You said the "S" word!
No I didn't.
[gets shocked again]
Ohhh shit!
What a crock.
Mary! Where did you hear that?

[On the phone]
What a crock!
Do you have a penis?
I think we need drinks.
I think we need shovels.
You love Sylvia and she loves you.
She loves me?
Yes!
Then why is she marrying Edward?
Because you never asked her.

[Peter is trying to unplug Mary's TV]
Pete, are you listening to me?
No, I'm electrocuting myself!
You are a selfish bastard!
I'm selfish? At least I didn't leave my baby on a doorstep when she was six months old!
[Sylvia slaps Peter]

[recovered from the punch Peter gave him]
Forgive me for bringing up a sticky point, but we are married.
Oh, God, he's right.

[as the vicar running down the aisle]
I beg to differ with you young man. But the ceremony is not officially over.
Shut up, you old fool!
Oh! He called me an old fool! I can hardly believe my ears!
[he pulls at his ears and pulls them off]

[Peter is looking thoughtfully out of the window at a building]
I'm sure that's nothing compared to some of your other marvellous erections!

[Peter, Sylvia, and Michael want Jack to be on time to the school interview]
Have I ever let you down before?
[everyone looks at him as if to say, "yes"]
I think she knows that actors are just like regular people.

[Enters dressed as Dracula]
Good afternoon.
Where are you gonna live?
London.
London, England?

[Sarcastically]
No, London, New Jersey.

[brings in breakfast]
Here's my specialty. Liver moose and poached eggs.

[looks at the tray and stammers]
What an attractive combination, but we do have a cook for these sort of things.
I like doing it.
Try it Edward. You'll like it.

[sees Mary holding her tea cup in the palm of her hand]
Whoever taught you to hold you teacup like that?
Edward is a wonderful person, but something keeps me from saying yes.
Would that something happen to be a tall architecht?

[Jack and Michael have come up with a list of potential husbands for Sylvia and Peter has rejected every one of them]
Bill, Billy Bob, Billy Joe? Come on, Peter, we're not asking you to marry the guy!

[Michael and Peter come to a cocktail party in tuxedos]
Has someone died?
Not yet.
Someone going to come to the airport to help me pick up my mother?
Jack can you do it?
Oh damn, I got that kidney operation this afternoon! What about you, Peter?
Michael, I'll give you $1,000 if you'll do it!

[on the phone]
We're building an office block for 15,000 people, we can't put a bathroom on every other floor.
[pause]
Well, what if they don't go before come to work?
Marry me.
Why Peter? For Mary's sake? You don't have to do that now. I'm moving back to New York and living there and you can see as much of Mary as you like.
It's not for Mary I'm doing this. I'm doing it for me. I love you.
No you don't.
Yes I do. I love you. I love the way you walk, I love the way you laugh, I love the way when you get nervous you bite your bottom lip just like you're doing now, I love the way you love Mary,
[to the congregation]
I even love her liver mousse. I love you and if there were no Mary, if there was nothing else I would still love you. And I want to make Mary all over again with you.
You love Sylvia, don't you?
Why do you say that?
Don't you. Oh come on Peter, just say how you feel.
All right, I love her.
Yes! Man, I wish there was a category like this on Jeopardy, I'd clean up. So why don't you tell her?
I'm scared.
Of what? Getting married again?
Yes. I love Sylvia. There, I've said it. I love her, I love her so much it hurts. But I'm scared, I'm scared of hurting her and Mary and you and Michael. And me.

[referring to Peter and Sylvia]
I think they're really starting to hate each other.
Don't kid yourself... I'm still in love with the first woman who hit me.

[Sylvia hands him a plate of burnt eggs and bacon]
Did I say overnight? I meant over light.

[pretending to be a vicar marrying Edward and Sylvia]
If there be anyone who knows why this lovely couple should not be joined in holy matrimony? You might as well lay it out on the table right now... Anyone? Anyone?
I think it's safe to continue!
Oh is that your hand back there? One, two, three, four, FIFTH from the left! Oh, I'm sorry! That's your hat!
Can we get on with it!
Where are they getting these hats from? Just think a piece of millinery almost kept you from getting married.

[disguised as the vicar]
Today, we join in holy matrimony, Edward and... oh no... oh dear.

[prompting the vicar]
Sylvia.
Oh yes. Today, we join in holy matrimony Ed and Sylvia... I knew a Slyvia once... no... she's dead...
[to Sylvia]
that's not you.

[Edward is helping Sylvia pull her veil from her face]
Oh what a beautiful bride. You know it's not too late... you can always change your mind... I'm available.
The primary school is...
...the first watershed in a child's life.
Have I said that before?
Not in the last five minutes, Pete.
When I was at summer camp, I bunked with a kid who collected farts.

[to a farmer]
Do you have a car we could borrow?
[farmer shakes his head]
A horse? Anything that moves?

[seeing the amount of luggage Vera brought with her]
What? No furniture?

[Peter has just gotten away]
Dammit.
Bride or groom, sir?
Just a guest.

[pointing to a set of armor]
How do you take a leak in one of these things?
Carefully, very carefully.

[arrives to Mary's school interview in a vampire costume]
I'm doing a commercial for margarine. I'm Count Cholesterol.

I know some of the children at this school and I know their parents. Family life is not easy. But of all the fathers, the step fathers, the half fathers that I've know, not one of them could love and support a child like these three men love Mary. There's nothing they wouldn't do for her. I just hope that there are other children who are as lucky as Mary is.

[after Mary's penis comment at the restaurant]
You're overreacting.
Yeah, what's a genital here and there?
Time to fish or cut bait.
Oh that's really romantic. Honey it's time to fish or cut bait.
I'd like a man who sweeps a girl off her feet.
Kinda like I swept you off your feet.
Knocked me off my feet is more like it.

[at the airport]
Welcome, Mrs. Bennington.
Oh, Michael.
Peter.

[Mrs. Bennington has just arrived]
Couldn't you stay a little longer, Vera?
I tried to change her mind.
Did someone open a window in here? Burrr!
If you think about it, if Mary and I hadn't moved in a taken up a part of your live, you'd all be in very different situations right now.
We'd be married.
We'd be divorced! You've saved us a fortune.

[seeing a knight]
Ah, a medieval version of permanent press.
The water closet is in here.

[yelling through a megaphone at Jack who is on the phone dressed with a fruit headress]
Hey, fruit of the loom! You're on.

[just married Peter and Sylvia]
You may now kiss the bride, again.
they're sending a replacement.
Ah! There you are. You can't swing a dead cat around here without hitting a vicar.

[Peter, Michael, and Jack are discussing potential suitors for Sylvia]
What about Edward?
He's English.
So is Sylvia!
Oh, no, that's an actor/director thing. They never last.
I'm leaving the day after tomorrow.
Aw gee... so soon.
[Peter and Michael also feign disappointment]

[Barrow comes out of the toilet but has forgotten to put his trousers back on]
Dinner will be served promptly at eight, gentlemen
[Michael covers Mary's eyes and Peter obstructs her view of him]

[to Sylvia, who's looking out a window]
What's the matter, darling?
I'm concerned about Mary.
Oh, she'll come around. You'll see.
And I'm nervous about tomorrow.
Don't you want to get married?
Yes, of course I do. I think so. I mean... yes, yes I do. But why do you ask?
Everything's going to be fine. I promise you...

[Peter and Michael come rushing in]
You sonofabitch! You're planning on sending Mary to that boarding school!
What are you talking about!
We went to Pileforth this afternoon.
He's planning to send Mary there!
In five or six years, that's a possibility, yes...
No, not in five or six years. Next term.
That's not true.
He's lying to you.
Rubbish.
Then why was Miss Lomax measuring Mary?
Was she?
For a uniform.
A gift. She asked me if she could give Mary a blazer.
Why?
Because she said that with all the presents Sylvia and I were going to get, Mary might feel left out.
I think that's a very sweet thought.
Yes, I thought so.
What a crock!
Do you want to marry me?
Jack!

[to Sylvia]
Wanna sleep on it?
She did that once before, Jack!
Hey, shut up!
[turns back to Sylvia]
Do you want to marry me?
No... but thank you for asking.
